column4: how do i enable ubuntus remote desktop feature via terminal.. its not located in my room anymore so can only access via ssh
you could install vncserver or something.
but if i can enable the inbuilt one remotley it would be quicker, lol
to enable XDMCP?  though you may have to hunt around on the forums
well thats what I believe the default one does is just enables vncserver.
thats fine, how do i enable that one via ssh
i dont have access to the box from where i am u see.. and want to use the gui
ahh well actually the default one shares the desktop some how it doesn't enable another instance of X on a different display
I have no idea how to do what you are asking.
so if i locked the screen on the machine, i cant access again using the inbuilt one unless i install vncserver?
The inbuilt one is quite differnt. Like I say I don't know enough about it to help.
how do i install vncserver ? do u have any good guides?
any ideas why i am unable to access shares on my unbuntu box through windows? it keeps rejecting the password?
you need to edit your smb.conf there is a great howto on ubuntu guide site.  You can even set it so it doens't prompt for password
one last question, is it possible for ubuntu to link to an active directory domain in windows?
I believe so let me give you a good site hold up
ubuntuguide.org
that site has a lot of howto's specifically for things you are asking.
just ssh in and use apt-get
apt-get uninstall ?
once you are logged in just sudo apt-get install <packagename>
i dont want to install, i want to un-install
unisntalling programs would be sudo apt-get remove <packagename>
